problem_text:
(W. Kimmerle). The prime graph (or Gruenberg–Kegel graph) Γ(X) of a group X has vertices labeled by primes appearing as orders of elements in X; two distinct primes p and q are adjacent in Γ(X) if and only if X contains an element of order pq. Denote by V(ZG) the group of normalized units of the integral group ring of a group G. Is it true that for each finite group G the prime graphs of G and V(ZG) coincide?
This question has been reduced to almost simple groups (W. Kimmerle, A. Konovalov, Internat. J. Algebra Comput., 27 (2017), 619–631).
A. B¨achle, L. Margolis
